result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Gregory Jacobs-Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.
  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.
  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $1785.00 to TCF bank joint and several with 15CF1832.  Restitution to be paid first.

EACH COUNT:  Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Pay DNA surcharges. Court waives DNA surcharges on the other counts due the imposition of the DNA surcharge on Count 1.
Pay all applicable court costs.
All applicable fees of supervision.
- No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
- The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: with 0 days credit CONCURRENT with Counts 2 & 4, consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to 13CF2422.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full-time employment. Obtain a GED/HSED.

No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs; no possession of drug paraphernalia.

Cooperate with the Probation Department.
Provide a DNA sample as to Count 1.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT with Counts 1 & 4, consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to 13CF2422.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING (22 pages) commencing NOVEMBER 5, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Justin Gregory Jacobs-Wright in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Justin Gregory Jacobs-Wright in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Zenobia W.

As to Count 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  12 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT with Counts 2 & 4; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.
As to Count 2 :  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  12 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT with Counts 1 & 4; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS
As to Count 4:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  12 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT with Counts 1 & 2; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS
These sentences are consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to 13CF2422.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program. 
 Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- Absolute sobriety
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs; no possession of drug paraphernalia
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment 
- Obtain a GED/HSED
- Provide a DNA sample as to Count 1.  Court waives DNA surcharges on the other counts due the imposition of the DNA surcharge on Count 1.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $1785.00 to TCF bank joint and several with 15CF1832.  Restitution to be paid first.
Pay DNA surcharges;
Pay all applicable court costs.
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determiate Sentence
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
dated 10/3/2015 from the defendant, received and filed

Defendant Justin Gregory Jacobs-Wright in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Justin Gregory Jacobs-Wright in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Counts 1, 2 & 4:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
As to Count 3:   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed and read in.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.
Defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
from defense counsel Carpenter to adjourn the 8/31/15 plea hearing to 9/1/15 at 1:30 pm
Order to Produce for Plea Hearing on August 31, 2015 @ 1:30 pm received and filed

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Justin Gregory Jacobs-Wright not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Branch 19 is in jury trial on another case.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Justin Gregory Jacobs-Wright not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.   All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Lisa Procaccio for Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Justin Gregory Jacobs-Wright not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Certified records received and filed. Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Justin Gregory Jacobs-Wright in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Justin Gregory Jacobs-Wright in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TCF Bank; Tric City National Bank; Kara G.; Jaela A.; Reem A.; Rolanda S.; Kali L or Co-Defendant Monte Lee

Defendant Justin Gregory Jacobs-Wright in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Justin Gregory Jacobs-Wright in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
